statement.tex:
\text{Find}\frac{dy}{dx}\text{ of the following}\\
ax + by^2 = \cos y

step.reason: \text{This is a standard formula.It is called Chain}\\ \text{Rule.Review it if you got this wrong.}\\

step.tex:
\text{After diffrentiating the equation we get}\\ \frac{d(ax + by^2)}{dx}=\frac{d(\cos y)}{dx}\\ \Rightarrow a . \frac{d(x)}{dx}+2(b) . \frac{d(y)}{dx}=\frac{d(\cos y)}{dx} . \frac{d(y)}{dx}\\ \Rightarrow a +2b . \frac{dy}{dx} = -\sin y . \frac{d(y)}{dx}\\
\text{After rearranging, we get}\\ \frac{dy}{dx}= \frac{-a}{2b+\sin y}
